Articles.Content:
@tutrakan4e: No. He mentioned that all personnel who have data or video/photographs of the launch should be kept separate for use by the FAA and so on in the investigation. It could help in discovering what went wrong.

And @SpaxeXRay is right. It's sad how our culture/civilisation is so focused on the negative and sensationalistic things.
Wow. Glad no life was lost just now

@tutrakan4e: No. He mentioned that all personnel who have data or video/photographs of the launch should be kept separate for use by the FAA and so on in the investigation. It could help in discovering what went wrong.

And @SpaxeXRay is right. It's sad how our culture/civilisation is so focused on the negative and sensationalistic things.

Ah, so I was helpful.

RIP something module, you were the first module I saw taking off and my first live explosion.

Let's rule out the facts:

it launched well, went clear of the tower, and then exploded midair with the engines on.

unlikely anything external influenced the thing.

Most likely an internal problem having something to do with the fuel.

JEB!!! What have you done!!!!

Seriously though, that's a big setback for Orbital, I'm glad nobody was aboard that. People won't be so quick to complain when SpaceX has their scrub-fever moments.

Edited October 28, 2014 by StrandedonEarth
Anyone but NASA would have turned off the cameras long ago.

Launch pad got damaged, but noone is hurt.

Looking forward for the investigation.

Latest reports: lower thrust than expected. Probably engine malfunction.

Edited October 28, 2014 by Sky_walker
Yeah but its worse than just building damage... our poor space program...

It did seem to me to be an internal problem with the fuel feed. It seemed to make a short burst and then lost thrust. Wasn't long after that that it exploded.

My gues is a fuel feed problem. Or something went wrong in the production of the engines closed loop gas cycle.(it does use the Aerojet NK_33's right?)
Ok, so just because nobody was hurt, I take humor in the fact that they say "There was an accident on board the Antares rocket shortly after liftoff" instead of "it blew up"

I caught this screenshot.

It was obvious something was wrong. There were sparks before slowing down. My guess - something got pierced. The turbopump perhaps, I don't know.

[someone in the chat]

i wonder what they will eat now1

Yep. I saw that and assumed it was normal

Then I walked away to look at the skies, wondered where the rocket was, and overheard them talking about "damage limited to the facility"

It's been a while since something exploded that is from the USA.

'Murica.

Thank goodness it was unmanned.
I blame the newest KSP update for this. Someone decided to try and take out the launchpad....
I feel sorry for the Wallop. They're not well known but have had a lot of successes.

[someone in the chat]

i wonder what they will eat now1

Well I know they wont be getting thier cake or whatever it was, saw the discussion with the 2 US crew on the ISS and a General, forget name, back in NASA control, mentioned about his treat sent up and was promised that all 6 would share it! ... well that aint happening now.
So what does this mean for Orbital? What do they do now for supplies? Can Orbital or... someone else I guess now just launch from the cape? Because the Virginia pad is defiantly destroyed...
I blame the newest KSP update for this, someone decided to take out the launchpad....
Video:

I'll start the ball rolling on the uninformed speculation

The NK-33 engine suffered a catastrophic failure due to burn- through either in the turbopump or the combustion chamber.

If I'm right, Please call me "Miss Cleo".

-Slashy

Why are people here laughing? Rocket failures are no joke...

I went to a field to try to watch the launch and just waited, was wondering what happened until I got home and saw the fire everywhere on NASA TV.
THere are videos already on Youtube

BTW: This was the launch with Planetary Resources space telescope. It most likely will be a huge setback for the company.

Not to mention that it'll be a setback for entire CCDev.

Good news; No loss of life, all accounted for.

Bad news; Crypto is scattered all over that field.
